parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
